channel.title: Need help
channel.description: Hi you may have seen me asking help for my client. Well i got it to work thanks to S!ms, but my friend wants it to show how many players there are in each world (I mean that when the mouse goes over a world it tells if it is full or how many people there are) and I said I'll try. I think you need php or something and i dont know any so if somebody could do it or help i would give credits. The site is [url=http://runenavi.tk]runenavi.tk[/url]

item.title: Need help
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

dunno how to do that… =P [br][size=1]Posted at: October 28, 2006, 07:51:22 AM[/size][hr]Just please could somebody do it. It would help my and my friends…

Read full topic

item.title: Need help
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

frank_:

download moparscape w/ aryan or ibot (or get the class from someone else) that parses the highscores page, decompile it and port it to PHP

Read full topic

item.title: Need help
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Nothing’s hard if you know how to do it

But I actually misunderstood your question before…I was under the impression that you wanted to add this on a private server. You’ll probably need some php knowledge for this (or knowledge of some server side language). You may be able to use javascript as well, but I forget if the browser can retrieve the source of a 3rd party website with JS.

What you’ll have to do is parse the world listing page on runescape.com to obtain the current number of players. You might want to use the link frank_ gave in this topic as an example, as it parses the html source of the high scores page: http://www.moparisthebest.org/smf/index.php/topic,29321.0.html

Read full topic

item.title: Need help
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

well is it hard could you guys do it cause i only know html…

Read full topic

item.title: Need help
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Your server would need to either broadcast the player count (by setting up a second server socket perhaps?) or write the count to a file every so often. Then you can either open a socket connection to the server’s broadcaster or just read the file it writes to to obtain the player count.

For the former, you definately need some server side scripting, such as php as frank_ mentioned. For the latter, however, you could even just use SSI…but php overall is probably your best bet

Read full topic

item.title: Need help
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede

@teh_spede wrote:

well could you help me? is it hard?

Read full topic

item.title: Need help
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

yes, you need PHP, or some other type of server-side scripting. using php you open a socket to your server to read the data, so you will have to edit your server to send the data that applies to what you want

Read full topic
